feed.title: Google Cloud: Confidential VM
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Confidential VM

entry.content:
Following a firmware update, Confidential VM instances with AMD SEV-SNP generate v4 attestation reports. Attestation report parsers that are designed for v3 attestation reports might break.

Customers using go-sev-guest to parse attestation reports can resolve attestation failures by updating to go-sev-guest v0.14.0 or above.

If you're writing your own parser, the attestation report format is defined by the SEV Secure Nested Paging Firmware ABI Specification.
entry.summary: Confidential VM instances with AMD SEV-SNP now generate v4 attestation reports. This may break existing attestation report parsers. Update to go-sev-guest v0.14.0 or above if you are using this library. For custom parsers, refer to the SEV Secure Nested Paging Firmware ABI Specification.
entry.title: Breaking: Confidential VM instances with AMD SEV-SNP generate v4 attestation reports

entry.content: A vulnerability affecting AMD Zen 5 processors (Turin) was discovered and is being addressed. For more information, see the GCP-2025-058 security bulletin.
entry.summary: A vulnerability affecting AMD Zen 5 processors has been discovered and is being addressed.
entry.title: Security: AMD Zen 5 Vulnerability

entry.content:
Support for accelerator-optimized a3-highgpu-1g machine type for securely running AI and ML workloads is now generally available, with the following specifications:

  • 4th Generation Intel Xeon Scalable processor (Sapphire Rapids)
  • Intel TDX
  • 1 NVIDIA H100 GPU
entry.summary: New machine type for AI and ML workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Accelerator-optimized a3-highgpu-1g

entry.content:
As of June 20, 2025, Confidential VM instances using AMD SEV-SNP or Intel TDX do not support remote attestation when running the following guest OS images:

  • SLES 15 SP7
  • Ubuntu 25.04

To restore remote attestation, use an earlier guest OS version such as SLES 15 SP6 or Ubuntu 24.04.
entry.summary: Confidential VM instances with AMD SEV-SNP or Intel TDX do not support remote attestation for SLES 15 SP7 and Ubuntu 25.04 as of June 20, 2025. To re-enable remote attestation, please use previous versions of the operating system, such as SLES 15 SP6 or Ubuntu 24.04.
entry.title: Issue: Confidential VM remote attestation issue

entry.content:
Support for general purpose C4D machine types is now generally available, featuring:

  • 5th generation AMD EPYC processors (Turin) and Google Titanium
  • AMD Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV) which can encrypt the memory of the VM to protect data in-use
entry.summary: New C4D machine types with 5th generation AMD EPYC processors and Google Titanium are now generally available, offering enhanced security with AMD Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV) to protect VM memory.
entry.title: Feature: C4D machine types now available
